DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior Attenuated Live Virus Vaccine Administered Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient has received live virus vaccines.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior Attenuated Live Virus Vaccine Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the prior administration of a live vaccines prepared from microorganisms which have undergone physical adaptation (e.g., by radiation or temperature conditioning) or serial passage in laboratory animal hosts or infected tissue/cell cultures, in order to produce avirulent mutant strain.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior Attenuated Live Virus Vaccine Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Live vaccines prepared from microorganisms which have undergone physical adaptation (e.g., by radiation or temperature conditioning) or serial passage in laboratory animal hosts or infected tissue/cell cultures, in order to produce avirulent mutant strains capable of inducing protective immunity. Live-attenuated vaccines are used when a CD8+ T Cell (cellular cytotoxicity) response is desired.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Live vaccines prepared from microorganisms which have undergone physical adaptation (e.g., by radiation or temperature conditioning) or serial passage in laboratory animal hosts or infected tissue/cell cultures, in order to produce avirulent mutant strains capable of inducing protective immunity. Live-attenuated vaccines are used when a CD8+ T Cell (cellular cytotoxicity) response is desired.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received live att
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received live attenuated vaccines within 1 week of the start?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has been assigned to receive therapy with everolimus, has patient received live attenuated vaccines within 1 week prior to start of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received live or live attenuated vaccine within 12 weeks prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received live vaccines within 30 days before the first dose of trial treatment and while participating in the trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received immunization with attenuated live vaccine within one week of study entry or during study period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received live, attenuated vaccine within 30 days prior to first dose of investigational treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received live, attenuated vaccines within 4 weeks prior to first dose of drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment or anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before initiation of study treatment or anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received live vaccinations within 28 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before Cycle 1, Day 1 or anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received live, attenuated vaccines within 4 weeks prior to dosing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before Randomization or anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have ongoing active infection or has received a live attenuated vaccine within 30 days of dosing with M3814?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last live, attenuated vaccine given more than 4 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before first dose of study treatment or anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study?
